form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cruz (for himself, Mr. Kennedy, Mr. Hagerty, Mr. Scott of Florida, Mr. Boozman, Mr. Hoeven, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Budd, Mr. Johnson, and Mr. Lankford) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide enhanced penalties for convicted murderers who kill or target America’s public safety officers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Thin Blue Line Act.
Section 3592(c) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after paragraph (16) the following:

paragraph.header: Killing or targeting of law enforcement officers

subparagraph.text: The defendant killed or attempted to kill, in a circumstance described in subparagraph (B), a person who is authorized by law—

clause.text: to engage in or supervise the prevention, detention, investigation, or prosecution of, or the incarceration of any person for, any criminal violation of law;
to apprehend, arrest, or prosecute an individual for any criminal violation of law; or
to be a firefighter or other first responder.

subparagraph.text: A circumstance referred to in subparagraph (A) is that the person was killed or targeted—

clause.text: while he or she was engaged in the performance of his or her official duties;
because of the performance of his or her official duties; or
because of his or her status as a public official or employee.
